meanings.sent1: The octosyllabic poem was short and easy to memorize.
meanings.sent2: The song had an octosyllabic rhythm that made it catchy.
meanings.sent3: The octosyllabic chant at the game got everyone pumped up.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an octosyllabic melody, light and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The octosyllabic nature of the rhyme scheme made it flow smoothly.

meanings.definition: A line of verse consisting of eight syllables.
meanings.sent1: The poet wrote a beautiful octosyllabic in his latest work.
meanings.sent2: In the sonnet, the octosyllabic added a musical quality to the lines.
meanings.sent3: The students enjoyed analyzing the octosyllabic in the classic poem.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was an octosyllabic, each word carefully chosen.
meanings.sent5: The octosyllabic in the ballad created a sense of rhythm and flow.
